critique: The document primarily conveys a sense of formal authorization and diplomatic negotiation. The President aims to project an image of competence, trustworthiness, and commitment to resolving international issues amicably. The language is formal and measured, suggesting a desire to inspire confidence and avoid strong emotional reactions. The primary emotion is Joy that the negotiations will be successful and that peace will be achieved. There is also an element of surprise that the negotiations are happening at all. There is no indication of sadness, anger, fear, or disgust.
